name: R5-AllergyIntoleranceCategory-R4-AllergyIntoleranceCategory
title: Concept map to convert a FHIR R5 AllergyIntoleranceCategory into a FHIR R4 AllergyIntoleranceCategory

element.display: A preparation that is synthesized from living organisms or their products, especially a human or animal protein, such as a hormone or antitoxin, that is used as a diagnostic, preventive, or therapeutic agent. Examples of biologic medications include: vaccines; allergenic extracts, which are used for both diagnosis and treatment (for example, allergy shots); gene therapies; cellular therapies.  There are other biologic products, such as tissues, which are not typically associated with allergies.

target.display: A preparation that is synthesized from living organisms or their products, especially a human or animal protein, such as a hormone or antitoxin, that is used as a diagnostic, preventive, or therapeutic agent. Examples of biologic medications include: vaccines; allergenic extracts, which are used for both diagnosis and treatment (for example, allergy shots); gene therapies; cellular therapies.  There are other biologic products, such as tissues, which are not typically associated with allergies.

element.display: Any substances that are encountered in the environment, including any substance not already classified as food, medication, or biologic.

target.display: Any substances that are encountered in the environment, including any substance not already classified as food, medication, or biologic.

element.display: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

target.display: Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

element.display: Substances administered to achieve a physiological effect.

target.display: Substances administered to achieve a physiological effect.
